projects.description: A Game Where A User Tries To Guess The Letters of a Random Phrase
A Directory Where A Limited Number of Users Are Displayed On Each Page
A Minimalistic Replica of Twitter. This Was a Group Project That I Did With My Classmates.
A Form That Provides Validation Errors When Not Filled Out Correctly
A Static Webpage The Renders Random Quotes Upon Clicking a Button
A Photoshop Design File That I Converted to a Webpage

This project is a Fullstack Web application that lets a user create, read, update, and delete courses that were created by them. However, a user is only able to view the courses that were created by other users, and unable to update or delete them. A user is also able to sign up/ sign in into the application using an email address and password. If the user enters any incorrect data into the compenents that render forms, they will be displayed with Validation Error messages, letting them know what they did wrong, and what they need to do to correct it.

A todo list web application I had created with vanilla javascript and axios for the api calls. A user can add a task by typing in a title, price, description, and attach a link to an image to identify the task more easily. A user is able to delete and edit items as well. Instead of the user having to refresh the page to see changes; the list will auto-update when an add, delete, or update is requested.

This is a React web application that will generate a name badge based on the values a user enters on a form. There is some form validation for the amount of characters that is required and how a user is supposed to enter their phone number. If a user doesn't fill in all the fields, the submit button remains disabled until all the fields have some value in them.

This is a React web application that utilizes a third-party API in order to get random memes. The user is able to preview what the meme will look like before saving it. The user is able to customize the text on the meme by providing the text that will appear on top and bottom. Once the user saves their meme, it will appear at the bottom of the page, and the input text boxes are automatically cleared. A user is able to delete and edit memes as well.

This application was built using the React framework. The application consists of a preview box, where a user can preview the color gradient that they are creating. The user also has the ability to choose a third color by clicking the plus button. Once the user is happy with the results, they are able to click the copy code button to use as they wish.

This application was built using the React framework. The application has 3 input fields that a user must enter a value in, or the submit button will not become active. Once the user clicks the submit button, their created Ugly Thing will appear in the scrollable box of Ugly Things. The state of this application is derived from a third-party API. The local state of the application is managed by the Context utility that is built in React.
